meanings.sent1: The children were circumambulating the playground during recess.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys circumambulating the park every morning for exercise.
meanings.sent3: The cat was circumambulating the tree, trying to catch a squirrel.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to be circumambulating the entire town, bringing life to its banks.
meanings.sent5: The tourists were circumambulating the ancient ruins, marveling at their beauty.

meanings.definition: Move around (something) in a circular course.
meanings.sent1: The cars were circumambulating the roundabout, waiting for their turn to exit.
meanings.sent2: The planets are constantly circumambulating around the sun in our solar system.
meanings.sent3: The dog was circumambulating its tail, trying to catch it playfully.
meanings.sent4: Time feels like it's circumambulating around us, never stopping.
meanings.sent5: The dancers were circumambulating the stage gracefully, mesmerizing the audience.
